Definition: You've been given a story and a sentence. You must determine whether the given statement contributes to the story's coherence. If it does, it will output "Yes" else it will output "No".

Positive Examples.input:
Story: Sally loved horses.She always wanted one of her own.Her parents said she would get one if she did well in school.Sally studied extra hard and made all As.
Sentence: Sally decided to get a cow instead of a horse.
Positive Examples.explanation: Sally loved horses and wanted to get a horse but then the sentence says that she decided to get a cow instead of a horse. Hence the sentence does not make the story coherent and so the output is correct.

Positive Examples.input:
Story: I was looking on craigslist and saw a free piano.The person needed to get rid of it and I called him.I got his address and showed up at his house.When I got there I saw the nice piano.
Sentence: I picked up the piano and then went home.
Positive Examples.explanation: Here, the sentence makes the story coherent. Hence, the output is correct.

Negative Examples.input:
Story: Nancy wanted to take a nap.Nancy decided that she would nap on her lunch break.After Nancy clocked out, Nancy went to her car.Once comfortable, Nancy fell asleep in her car.
Sentence: When Nancy woke up, it was time to go home.
Negative Examples.explanation: Nancy slept in her car and when she woke up it was time to go home. This makes perfect sense and the sentence makes the story coherent. Hence, the output is incorrect and the correct output is "yes".

Negative Examples.input:
Story: Gina was carrying a clean bedspread upstairs.She was carrying it in her arms.She had a hard time keeping it off the floor.Her arms were too small to hold the whole bedspread.
Sentence: Gina folded the bedspread so she could carry it easier.
Negative Examples.explanation: Output can only be "yes" and "no". The correct output here is "Yes".

Story: Tea was chewing some bubble gum on the couch.She accidentally fell asleep.When she woke up, she found the gum had fallen into her hair.She had to get it cut out.
Sentence: Tea put another piece of gum in her hair.

Story: Ana was at a town festival.She was nervous because the President was coming!When she saw his car approach, she almost fainted.But then he got out and smiled at her.
Sentence: She jeered and yelled at him.

Story: Nick was at a baseball game during the evening.He stepped up to the plate so that he could bat.The pitcher threw a fastball at him.Nick saw the ball and hit it for a home run.
Sentence: Nick ran the bases with a big smile on his face.

Story: Gina's knew pencils were gone.And she knew a boy named Dave had taken them.She decided she would confront him to get them back.She marched to his desk and begin yelling.
Sentence: Gina was very angry.

Story: Ed went to the supermarket with a stack of coupons.He loaded a cart with a lot of food.When he went to check out he took out his coupons.The coupons reduced the bill by a lot of money.
Sentence: Ed was very happy about the money he'd saved.

Story: Joe woke up to a lot of loud noises outside.It sounded very bad, very windy.He turned on the news and saw that there was a tornado warning!The warning said to take cover immediately!
Sentence: Joe quickly collected his things and went to the shelter.

Story: One day, my wife's sister came over to the house to show us her puppy.She told us that she had just gotten the puppy across the street.My sons begged me to get them one.I told them that if they would care for it, they could have it.
Sentence: We then grabbed a small kitten.

Story: Tina really wanted the exclusive Birkin bag.No store in the country had it in stock.Hence she was forced to go and fly to Paris to get it.Thankfully she found one in Paris for a good price.
Sentence: Tina was not going to fly to Paris just to buy a handbag.

Story: Maria smelled the fresh Autumn air and decided to celebrate.She wanted to make candy apples.She picked up the ingredients at a local market and headed home.She cooked the candy and prepared the apples.
Sentence: Mari's apple pie was delicious.

Story: Bernie started to get tired of telemarketing calls.The phone had already rung six times in the past few hours.The phone just then rang again.Bernie picked up the phone to hear some snickering.
Sentence: Bernie loved phone calls from strangers.

Story: Gina had purchased a CD single of a song she liked.There were only 2 songs printed on the CD.She was anxious to hear the second song.This was a new artist so she hadn't heard much from him.
Sentence: After listening she liked the 2nd song more than the first.

Story: James planted an apple tree in his yard.It grew to about 5 feet in a few Year's.Unfortunately, James had to move away.Year's later he came back to visit his old hometown.
Sentence: The apple tree was still there.

Story: Rex notices that he has trouble seeing objects that are far away.He decides to have his eyes tested.The eye doctor tells Rex that he needs to start wearing glasses.Rex finds that he loves his new look with glasses.
Sentence: Rex wears his glasses everyday.

Story: John was at work and began running fever.His back started to hurt.His boss sent him to urgent care.The doctor did a flu test.
Sentence: John went home with the pretty nurse.

Story: Greg hated taking the trash out.He decided not to do it.The trashcan was overflowing in just a few days.Finally, his father put the trash on his bed.
Sentence: After taking out the trash his bed still smelled.

Story: Danny wanted to build a kite but didn't know how.He asked his grandpa to help him.Danny's grandpa gave him a list of things to get at the store.After getting the items Danny and his grandpa worked all afternoon.
Sentence: At the end of the day, Danny and his grandpa flew the kite.

Story: Casey was competing in a school talent show.She was incredibly nervous.All she could think about was all eyes on her.Thankfully when she hit the stage her nerves cooled.
Sentence: Casey did a wonderful job.

Story: Ashley was packing all her belongings.She was moving far away to a new city.She was really upset about leaving her friends.However she got on the train with her suitcases anyways.
Sentence: She was glad to leave her friends.

Story: Abe really enjoyed numbers and statistics.He was curious how many guns the population of Stanford owned.He sent out a survey.Abe spent weeks tallying the results.
Sentence: The results were inconclusive and Abe didn't care.

Story: Gina wanted to read her book as they drove on the highway.But the backseat was too dark.She tried to use her phone as a light.But that just drained the battery, and gave her wrist a cramp.
Sentence: Since the battery was dead, she threw it away.

Story: Steve was always told to never fight with other kids.It was bad to get into a fight, or so his mother always told him.However at school there were some bullies that wouldn't leave.So one day he got into a fight with one of them.
Sentence: Steve decided to treat himself to ice cream.

Story: Gina's CD player was broken.But she had a tape deck.The tape deck was more work than the CD player.If she wanted to hear a song again she had to rewind the tape.
Sentence: Gina bought a new CD player.

Story: Dany was a six year old boy who loved to play football.One day Danny was crying because he was lonely.Dany's father was home early from work that day.Dany asked his dad to play football with him.
Sentence: His dad was happy to play with him.

Story: Rudy really wanted a dog.He begged his parents for one.They said if he cared for it, he could have one.Rudy agreed to walk and feed it every day.
Sentence: Rudy's parents decided not to get him a dog.

Story: Jim really wanted a new smart watch.He started saving his money because the watch was very expensive.One day he walked into work and there was a present on his desk.His boss had bought him a smart watch because of his excellent work.
Sentence: Jim was delighted.

Story: Harry has been stuck at the office working very late tonight.He is hungry but there aren't many stores open.Finally he remembers that the local fried chicken restaurant is open.He eats two delicious pieces of fried chicken.
Sentence: Harry's hunger is satiated.

Story: Kaylie and Martin had finally set their wedding date.Kaylie was eagerly awaiting the big day.The day of the wedding, Martin was nowhere to be found.Kaylie, her family and friends were devastated.
Sentence: Kaylie decided Martin was not faithful.

Story: Tim had a dentist appointment today.He was going to get his wisdom teeth pulled.His dentist numbed his gums.His wisdom teeth popped out instantly.
Sentence: He wished pulling the teeth would be more difficult.

Story: I loved to eat honey with my oatmeal.One day I unexpectedly ran out of honey.I did not want to eat my oatmeal without honey so I went to the store.Alas, they had run out of their honey stock.
Sentence: I felt so defeated.

Story: The family decided to go to the park for Veteran's Day.We had a barbecue outside.In addition, everyone decided to take a swim in the water.Before we left, we had a huge cake.
Sentence: We then swam for an hour at the lake.

Story: Avery needed to get to work.She wanted to take the bus or a cab.She found she had no money, credit cards or tokens.She realized that she had no options but to walk.
Sentence: Avery put on her shoes and began her trek.

Story: Bev was cleaning out her childhood bedroom.Her parents were moving after 25 Years in the same house.She came across her diary from 7th grade.She smiled as she read the thoughts of her younger self.
Sentence: Bev was upset her parents threw away her diary.

Story: Francis had always wanted to become a history teacher.He studied history very diligently in college.Finally he applied for a job teaching history at a middle school.He worked hard to be the best teacher he could be.
Sentence: He won an award for best teacher his very first year.

Story: Neil was visiting Asia.He flew into Laos and saw the sights.Then he took a river cruise up the Mekong river.It was wild and beautiful.
Sentence: Neil had a great time.

Story: Kelly was taking her daughter to get her first shot.Her daughter got scared and started crying.Kelly tried to soothe her.The shot was painful.
Sentence: Kelly's daughter started laughing.

Story: Louisa is trying to think of the perfect gift for her grandson.She decides to knit him a pair of mittens.Louisa buys a bright red spool of yarn for the mittens.Her grandson is very happy when he sees his new mittens.
Sentence: Her grandson thanks Louisa for the wonderful gift.

Story: Debbie wanted to be a rock star.After she graduated she moved to LA to start a band.She had no money and less experience.She saved up to buy a guitar.
Sentence: Debbie practiced every day for four hours.

Story: Jim was teaching his son to ride a bike.At first he taught the boy with training wheels.Then he removed the wheels.Jim was so happy he almost cried to see his son peddling.
Sentence: Jim re-attached the training wheels.

Story: Ron planted a tree in his backyard to shade his house.But it took Years and Years to grow.When Ron was old, the tree was tall and beautiful.And he was proud of himself for taking care of it throughout the Year's
Sentence: Ron's tree would shade others for years to come.

Story: George found a mistake on his cable bill.He called the cable company's customer service number.George was put on hold for a while.Finally, a man answered the phone who could help George.
Sentence: George explained what was going on with his bill.

Story: Lisa was at the beach.And she saw someone flying a kite.It looked like a lot of fun.So Lisa bought a kite of her own.
Sentence: Lisa broke her kite when a seagull got tangled in the  line.

Story: Max was determined to reach his goal of making extra money.He asked his family, friend, and co-workers for extra work.He did not mind working harder to reach his goal.He finally found a job on Mturk.
Sentence: He stood on the street corner asking for money.

Story: Daniel walked through a park to his girlfriend's house.On the way, he noticed a patch of beautiful wildflowers.Daniel carefully picked several of the flowers.He gave them to his girlfriend when he arrived at her house.
Sentence: She looked in disgust and slammed the door in Daniel's face.

Story: Ana's family was all visiting her house for Christmas.Suddenly a snow storm rose up and the weather grew bad.Two feet of snow fell!Ana's family was all snowed in at her house.
Sentence: Ana walked to work because the weather was so lovely.

Story: Today's lab assignment turned out to be a disaster.Since my teammates were confused, I had to guide them.This includes showing them how to do every procedure.Although we finished after everyone else, I put in a lot of effort.
Sentence: The team didn't need me that day.

Story: A police officer pulled a woman over for speeding.She protested that she had not been speeding.The officer wrote the ticket anyway.She went to traffic court to argue the ticket.
Sentence: The woman succeeded in reversing her ticket.

Story: Howard is a senior.He feels a lot of bittersweet thoughts.He holds a senior party with all of his friends.They all enjoyed it and drank a lot.
Sentence: Howard liked socializing.

Story: Vanessa hired a babysitter that liked to snoop.She snooped in makeup drawers.She snooped in jewelry boxes.She snooped in medicine cabinets.
Sentence: Vanessa caught her snooping, and fired her.

Story: I received a lumbar puncture today.After hugging a friend of mines, I noticed a huge pain on my back.Although decided to take a nap, the pain didn't go away.When the pain was unbearable, I decided to go to the emergency room.
Sentence: They were forced to operate on me and then I felt better.

Story: Jay was starting his first shift as a dog walker.He was afraid.He feared the dogs would be mean to him!But then he found that they were all very friendly.
Sentence: Jay was now more terrified of dogs than ever before.

Story: Tony loved Maria.They had been dating for a year.He decided to propose to her.He got her a great ring and popped the question.
Sentence: Maria said yes.

Story: I worked two shifts one night.On the way home i could barely see the road.I barely missed hitting an oncoming car.it swerved at the last minute.
Sentence: I decided to drive at that time of night every night.

Story: A man turned away from his dinner to answer the telephone.When he turned back, his dinner was gone.He looked around, and saw his dog quietly sneaking out of the room.The dog chanced a glance back at the man.
Sentence: The dog had gravy on his face from the mans dinner.

Story: Amy was moving to her new apartment.She took weeks to pack up her things in her apartment.When moving day came her brother said he could no longer help her move.Amy called a moving company to move her things.
Sentence: The moving company sold her furniture on eBay.

Story: The dogs romped in the deep snow.The snow was so deep that the smaller dog disappeared in a drift.The bigger dog looked confused and began to dig.The smaller dog ran out from behind the drift.
Sentence: The bigger dog couldn't find the smaller dog.

Story: Sarah is a ballet teacher.She teaches a class of small children.She wanted to teach the children to dance for a pageant.It was a lot of work, but all the children were happy to do it.
Sentence: Sarah found teaching children very boring.

Story: Nick turned 18 on Sunday.His girlfriend Zoe came to his birthday party.Zoe bought him a lottery card for his birthday.He anxiously scratched off the numbers.
Sentence: Nick won a thousand dollars.

Story: Lonnie loaned his sister a lot of money.She promised to pay him back when she got her check.She received her check but did not tell Lonnie.She spent her whole check without paying him anything.
Sentence: Lonnie thanked his sister for repaying him with interest.

Story: Drew was drawing a picture when he heard meowing at the door.He opened the door to find a wet, dirty kitten standing at the door.Drew decided to draw flyers to post around town about the kitten.Three days later, a man named Larry called about his lost kitten.
Sentence: Larry came to pick up his kitten.

Story: Today I wrote a lot of stories.I sat down and thought about each one.Then, I typed it carefully into the boxes.Finally, I submitted the stories.
Sentence: I hoped my computer would erase my stories.

Story: Phillip was the shortest kid in his class.He felt embarrassed sometimes about his height.During the summer, he hit a growth spurt.Phillip ended up growing 6 inches.
Sentence: Phillip was embarrassed.

Story: It was Dan's turn to present his research project.He stood up in front of the class and started talking.One of the classmate's phone rang in class.She immediately turned it off.
Sentence: She then turned it back on to check her messages.

Story: Coy needed new sneakers.She went to the store and examined their selection.She settled on a lovely blue pair.And the price was just right, too!
Sentence: Coy bought a more expensive pair of sneakers.

Story: Rita was invited to her friend John's birthday party.Rita wanted to look her best for the party.She went to the department store to find a dress.She tried on several dresses of different colors.
Sentence: She found a great yellow one.

Story: Sue was nervous about taking the driver's test.But she had been practicing a lot so she felt confident in her skills.She arrived at the DMV and the driving instructor greeted her.The test was going well, until Sue's car started to overheat.
Sentence: Sue would have to wait five weeks to take the test again.

Story: Christian wanted to eat something quick before school.He went into the kitchen and poured some cereal.When he was pouring the milk, he spilled it all over the table.Christian got mad because he had to clean all of it up.
Sentence: Christian was worried he was going to be late for school.

Story: Today is Andy's Birthday.Andy wants a chocolate cake for his birthday party.But, Andy's mom forgot to pick up eggs from the grocery store.Andy has to eat salad instead of chocolate cake.
Sentence: Andy was still asleep.

Story: The Lambert family was hungry and needed to pick up dinner.They saw a commercial for Steak and Shake on television.The commercial said they have four dollar meals.The Lamberts went to the restaurant and ate hamburgers.
Sentence: The Lamberts then went to another restaurant.

Story: Lulu and Jill had been friends for Years.However this summer they had a disagreement.The fight ruined their friendship.Lulu was not sure they could be friends again.
Sentence: Jill reached out, however, and they repaired their relationship.

Story: Beth's daughter was coming to town and bringing her kids.Beth was excited to see her grandchildren.When her daughter arrived she played and baked cookies with the kids.The kids stayed 2 weeks before returning home.
Sentence: Beth and her grandchildren baked cookies everyday!

Story: Terry's car broke down.He wasn't able to afford a rental.He decided to take the bus.To his surprise it was a pleasant experience.
Sentence: He went swimming in the pool.

Story: The awards ceremony began.The manager announced the awards for all of his employees.Everyone believed that Jane would receive the most outstanding award.However, the manager gave the award to Hannah.
Sentence: Jane was crushed.

Story: Eli Young loved Elvis Presley.He would sing and dance like him in the mirror.When he turned eighteen he moved to Las Vegas.He decided to work the strip as an impersonator.
Sentence: Eli loved his career.

Story: Blake loved to go hiking.He would always take his favorite boots when he went hiking.One day, Blake went on a really rough hike.He stepped through jagged rocks and rugged terrain.
Sentence: Blake felt lucky to have such good boots.

Story: The 7th grader wore high heels to school.She looked like a colt trying to walk.She ended up falling.She had to go to the nurse.
Sentence: The 7th grader's parents were very pleased.

Story: My Dad tried to buy a car yesterday.He went to the local dealership.He had some ideas in mind.But the dealer kept pushing other options.
Sentence: Dad got what he wanted, though.

Story: Jake had recently gotten a new cell phone.The very first thing he tried to do was take a selfie.He dropped his phone on the pavement while trying to do so.His phone was scuffed up on the back side.
Sentence: Jake was depressed  when he  saw  the condition of the old house.

Story: Larry decided to write his girlfriend a love letter.He wanted to let her know how much she meant to him.He started out writing about how they met.In addition, he talked about her character and her positive qualities.
Sentence: He ended the letter telling her he was leaving her.

Story: Yesterday I was putting up the Christmas tree.I picked up the prettiest ornaments.As I picked one up, it dropped.The glass shattered.
Sentence: I let my dog eat it.

Story: Alex needed to go to work.She looked at the bus schedule.She saw that there was a bus in five minutes.She walked to the bus stop.
Sentence: The bus arrived on time and Alex got to work.

Story: Mary went to the market on Sunday for fruit.She bought bananas but couldn't find any peaches.She decided that she would wait on the peaches until next time.When she went again there were still no peaches.
Sentence: Mary didn't want peaches.

Story: The astronaut sat strapped into his chair.His face was cold determination, but he was nervous.He remembered his training and focused on the mission.The rocket booster began to ignite, this was it.
Sentence: The astronaut ate a donut.

Story: Ella wanted to be a comedian.One night her local comedy club had an amateur night.Ella decided to try it out.She went onstage and told her jokes.
Sentence: The audience's laughter told Ella she should pursue her dream.

Story: Florence loves the way that her friends look in summer dresses.She decides that she wants to have one too.She visits her local mall and finds a beautiful dress with flowers.Florence tries it on and it fits perfectly.
Sentence: She felt beautiful with her new dress on.

Story: Ted wished for a drum set for Christmas.He wrote a letter to Santa to ask for the drums he wanted.Ted behaved really well to ensure he'd get his wish.Christmas Eve came and he was worried Santa may not come.
Sentence: Ted was relieved when Santa brought him exactly what he wanted.

Story: My mom always tells me to wake up and enjoy the sunrise.She tells me I miss out on all of life's beauty staying in.So I woke up extra early and sat on my balcony with some coffee.The sun rose shortly after 6 in the morning.
Sentence: I never liked my mom.

Story: A radio DJ announced a prize to the 100th caller.The DJ was lying about the prize.He just enjoyed talking to people on the phone.He told each caller that they were the 99th caller.
Sentence: Several called back to win the prize, and caught the DJ lying.

Story: Baby Martin was 7 months when he tried a Banana.He was a very curious baby.He loved to eat carrots and sweet peas.One day his dad decides to give him a banana
Sentence: Baby Martin was sick of bananas.

Story: Linda always wanted to learn to ice skate.She asked her mom to sign her up for lesson.She fell over and over again.She kept practicing every day.
Sentence: Linda gave up easily.

Story: My dog was walking stiffly in the cold.So, we took him to the vet.Upon examination, the vet diagnosed him with arthritis.Now my dog takes medication.
Sentence: We don't need to give him medication.

Story: Bob needed money.He decided to look for a part time job.He applied to five different places.One of them gave Bob an interview.
Sentence: Bob excelled in the interview and got the job.

Story: Tiff wanted to lose body fat.She needed some motivation to be successful.Tiff joined a dietbet for thirty five dollars.She was successful at her goal.
Sentence: Tiff was encouraged to do more.
